# Draft:List of National Literary Award winners for Urdu

The National Literary Awards are a set of annual literary honors given by the Pakistan Academy of Letters since 1981. Urdu is one of several languages in which awards are provided. Two awards were originally conferred (the Allama Iqbal Award and the Bābā’e Urdu Maulvi Abdul Haqq Award), with a new award (the Saadat Hasan Manto Award) being conferred since 2017.
The Allama Iqbal Award
The award is named after Muhammad Iqbal, and is conferred annually for the best book of Urdu poetry published that year. It was first awarded in 1981.

The Bābā’e Urdu Maulvi Abdul Haqq Award
The award is named after Abdul Haq, and is conferred annually for the best book of criticism in Urdu. Between 1981 and 2017, the award was conferred for all Urdu prose, including fiction.
